  20bad_sentinel = "_NA_"
  21
  22
  23def replace_bad_with_sentinel(ar: List) -> numpy.ndarray:
  24    """
  25    Replace None/NaN entries in iterable with '_NA_'
  26    :param ar: iterable
  27    :return: one dimensional numpy array
  28    """
  29
  30    ar = numpy.array(ar)
  31    bads = pandas.isnull(ar)
  32    ar[bads] = bad_sentinel
  33    return ar
  34
  35
  36def ready_data_frame(d) -> Tuple[pandas.DataFrame, type]:
  37    """
  38    Convert an array-like object to a data frame for processing.
  39
  40    :param d: data frame like object to work with
  41    :return: dataframe with string-named columns
  42    """
  43    orig_type = type(d)
  44    if not isinstance(d, pandas.DataFrame):
  45        d = pandas.DataFrame(d)
  46    else:
  47        d = d.copy()
  48    d.columns = [str(c) for c in d.columns]  # convert column names to strings
  49    return d, orig_type
  50
  51
  52def back_to_orig_type_data_frame(
  53    d: pandas.DataFrame, orig_type: type
  54) -> Tuple[Any, List[str]]:
  55    """
  56    Convert data frame back to ndarray if that was the original type.
  57
  58    :param d: data frame
  59    :param orig_type: type of original object
  60    :return: converted result
  61    """
  62    if not isinstance(d, pandas.DataFrame):
  63        raise TypeError(
  64            "Expected result to be a pandas.DataFrame, found: " + str(type(d))
  65        )
  66    columns = [c for c in d.columns]
  67    if orig_type == numpy.ndarray:
  68        d = numpy.asarray(d)
  69    return d, columns

  72class VarTransform(abc.ABC):
  73    """
  74    Base class for vtreat transforms
  75    """
  76
  77    incoming_column_name_: str
  78    incoming_column_is_numeric_: bool
  79    derived_column_names_: List[str]
  80    need_cross_treatment_: bool
  81    treatment_: str
  82    refitter_: Optional[Callable]
  83    extra_args_: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]
  84    params_: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]
  85
  86    def __init__(
  87        self,
  88        *,
  89        incoming_column_name: str,
  90        incoming_column_is_numeric: bool,
  91        derived_column_names: Iterable[str],
  92        treatment: str,
  93    ):
  94        """
  95
  96        :param incoming_column_name:
  97        :param incoming_column_is_numeric:
  98        :param derived_column_names:
  99        :param treatment:
 100        """
 101
 102        assert isinstance(incoming_column_name, str)
 103        assert isinstance(incoming_column_is_numeric, bool)
 104        assert not isinstance(derived_column_names, str)
 105        derived_column_names = list(derived_column_names)
 106        assert len(derived_column_names) > 0
 107        assert numpy.all([isinstance(dni, str) for dni in derived_column_names])
 108        assert isinstance(treatment, str)
 109        self.incoming_column_name_ = incoming_column_name
 110        self.incoming_column_is_numeric_ = incoming_column_is_numeric
 111        self.derived_column_names_ = derived_column_names
 112        self.treatment_ = treatment
 113        self.need_cross_treatment_ = False
 114        self.refitter_ = None
 115        self.extra_args_ = None
 116        self.params_ = None
 117
 118    @abc.abstractmethod
 119    def transform(self, data_frame: pandas.DataFrame) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 120        """
 121        return a transformed data frame
 122
 123        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
 124        :param data_frame: incoming values
 125        :return: transformed values
 126        """
 127
 128    @abc.abstractmethod
 129    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 130        """
 131        Return description of transform as a data frame.
 132
 133        :return: description of transform.
 134        """

 137class TreatmentPlan:
 138    """
 139    Class to carry treatment plans.
 140    """
 141
 142    outcome_name: Optional[str]
 143    cols_to_copy: Tuple[str, ...]
 144    num_list: Tuple[str, ...]
 145    cat_list: Tuple[str, ...]
 146    xforms: Tuple[VarTransform, ...]
 147
 148    def __init__(
 149            self,
 150            *,
 151            outcome_name: Optional[str] = None,
 152            cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
 153            num_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
 154            cat_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
 155            xforms: Iterable[Optional[VarTransform]]):
 156        self.outcome_name = outcome_name
 157        if cols_to_copy is None:
 158            self.cols_to_copy = tuple()
 159        else:
 160            assert not isinstance(cols_to_copy, str)
 161            self.cols_to_copy = tuple(cols_to_copy)
 162        if num_list is None:
 163            self.num_list = tuple()
 164        else:
 165            assert not isinstance(num_list, str)
 166            self.num_list = tuple(num_list)
 167        if cat_list is None:
 168            self.cat_list = tuple()
 169        else:
 170            assert not isinstance(cat_list, str)
 171            self.cat_list = tuple(cat_list)
 172        non_empty_xforms: List[VarTransform] = [x for x in xforms if x is not None]
 173        self.xforms = tuple(non_empty_xforms)
 174        for c in self.cols_to_copy:
 175            assert isinstance(c, str)
 176        for c in self.num_list:
 177            assert isinstance(c, str)
 178        for c in self.cat_list:
 179            assert isinstance(c, str)
 180        if len(self.xforms) < 1:
 181            raise ValueError("no treatments generated")
 182        for x in self.xforms:
 183            assert isinstance(x, VarTransform)
 184

 186class MappedCodeTransform(VarTransform):
 187    """Class for transforms that are a dictionary mapping of strings to numeric values"""
 188
 189    def __init__(
 190        self,
 191        *,
 192        incoming_column_name: str,
 193        derived_column_name: str,
 194        treatment: str,
 195        code_book: pandas.DataFrame,
 196    ):
 197        """
 198
 199        :param incoming_column_name:
 200        :param derived_column_name:
 201        :param treatment:
 202        :param code_book: Pandas dataframe mapping values to impact codes
 203        """
 204
 205        VarTransform.__init__(
 206            self,
 207            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 208            incoming_column_is_numeric=False,
 209            derived_column_names=[derived_column_name],
 210            treatment=treatment,
 211        )
 212        self.code_book_ = code_book
 213
 214    def transform(self, data_frame: pandas.DataFrame) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 215        """
 216        return a transformed data frame
 217
 218        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
 219        :param data_frame: incoming values
 220        :return: transformed values
 221        """
 222
 223        incoming_column_name = self.incoming_column_name_
 224        derived_column_name = self.derived_column_names_[0]
 225        sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: data_frame[incoming_column_name]})
 226        bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
 227        sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
 228        res = pandas.merge(
 229            sf, self.code_book_, on=[self.incoming_column_name_], how="left", sort=False
 230        )  # ordered by left table rows
 231        # could also try pandas .map()
 232        res = res[[derived_column_name]].copy()
 233        res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[derived_column_name]), derived_column_name] = 0.0
 234        return res
 235
 236    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 237        """
 238        Return description of transform as a data frame.
 239
 240        :return: description of transform.
 241        """
 242
 243        description = pandas.DataFrame(
 244            {
 245                "treatment_class": "MappedCodeTransform",
 246                "treatment": self.treatment_,
 247                "orig_var": self.incoming_column_name_,
 248                "orig_was_numeric": self.incoming_column_is_numeric_,
 249                "variable": self.derived_column_names_[0],
 250                "value": replace_bad_with_sentinel(
 251                    self.code_book_[self.incoming_column_name_]
 252                ),
 253                "replacement": self.code_book_[self.derived_column_names_[0]].copy(),
 254            }
 255        )
 256        return description
 257

 259class YAwareMappedCodeTransform(MappedCodeTransform):
 260    """Class for transforms that are a y-aware dictionary mapping of values"""
 261
 262    def __init__(
 263        self,
 264        incoming_column_name: str,
 265        derived_column_name: str,
 266        treatment: str,
 267        code_book: pandas.DataFrame,
 268        refitter,
 269        extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
 270        params: Dict[str, Any],
 271    ):
 272        """
 273
 274        :param incoming_column_name: name of incoming column
 275        :param derived_column_name: name of incoming column
 276        :param treatment: name of treatment
 277        :param code_book: pandas data frame mapping values to codes
 278        :param refitter: function to re-fit
 279        :param extra_args: extra args for fit_* functions
 280        :param params: configuration control parameters
 281        """
 282
 283        MappedCodeTransform.__init__(
 284            self,
 285            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 286            derived_column_name=derived_column_name,
 287            treatment=treatment,
 288            code_book=code_book,
 289        )
 290        self.need_cross_treatment_ = True
 291        self.refitter_ = refitter
 292        self.extra_args_ = extra_args
 293        self.params_ = params

 296class CleanNumericTransform(VarTransform):
 297    """Class for numeric column cleaner."""
 298
 299    def __init__(self,
 300                 *,
 301                 incoming_column_name: str,
 302                 replacement_value: float):
 303        """
 304
 305        :param incoming_column_name:
 306        :param replacement_value:
 307        """
 308
 309        VarTransform.__init__(
 310            self,
 311            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 312            incoming_column_is_numeric=True,
 313            derived_column_names=[incoming_column_name],
 314            treatment="clean_copy",
 315        )
 316        self.replacement_value_ = replacement_value
 317
 318    def transform(self, data_frame: pandas.DataFrame) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 319        """
 320        return a transformed data frame
 321
 322        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
 323        :param data_frame: incoming values
 324        :return: transformed values
 325        """
 326
 327        col = vtreat.util.safe_to_numeric_array(data_frame[self.incoming_column_name_])
 328        bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(col)
 329        col[bad_posns] = self.replacement_value_
 330        res = pandas.DataFrame({self.derived_column_names_[0]: col})
 331        return res
 332
 333    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 334        """
 335        Return description of transform as a data frame.
 336
 337        :return: description of transform.
 338        """
 339
 340        description = pandas.DataFrame(
 341            {
 342                "treatment_class": ["CleanNumericTransform"],
 343                "treatment": [self.treatment_],
 344                "orig_var": [self.incoming_column_name_],
 345                "orig_was_numeric": [self.incoming_column_is_numeric_],
 346                "variable": [self.derived_column_names_[0]],
 347                "value": [bad_sentinel],
 348                "replacement": [self.replacement_value_],
 349            }
 350        )
 351        return description

 354class IndicateMissingTransform(VarTransform):
 355    """Class for missing value indicator."""
 356
 357    def __init__(self,
 358                 *,
 359                 incoming_column_name: str,
 360                 incoming_column_is_numeric: bool,
 361                 derived_column_name: str):
 362        """
 363
 364        :param incoming_column_name:
 365        :param derived_column_name:
 366        """
 367
 368        VarTransform.__init__(
 369            self,
 370            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 371            incoming_column_is_numeric=incoming_column_is_numeric,
 372            derived_column_names=[derived_column_name],
 373            treatment="missing_indicator",
 374        )
 375
 376    def transform(self, data_frame: pandas.DataFrame) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 377        """
 378        return a transformed data frame
 379
 380        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
 381        :param data_frame: incoming values
 382        :return: transformed values
 383        """
 384
 385        col = vtreat.util.is_bad(data_frame[self.incoming_column_name_])
 386        res = pandas.DataFrame({self.derived_column_names_[0]: col + 0.0})
 387        return res
 388
 389    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 390        """
 391        Return description of transform as a data frame.
 392
 393        :return: description of transform.
 394        """
 395        description = pandas.DataFrame(
 396            {
 397                "treatment_class": ["IndicateMissingTransform"],
 398                "treatment": [self.treatment_],
 399                "orig_var": [self.incoming_column_name_],
 400                "orig_was_numeric": [self.incoming_column_is_numeric_],
 401                "variable": [self.derived_column_names_[0]],
 402                "value": [bad_sentinel],
 403                "replacement": [1.0],
 404            }
 405        )
 406        return description

 409def fit_clean_code(
 410    *,
 411    incoming_column_name: str,
 412    x,
 413    params: Dict[str, Any],
 414    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
 415) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 416    """
 417    Fit numeric clean column imputation transform
 418
 419    :param incoming_column_name: name of column
 420    :param x: training values for column
 421    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 422    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
 423    :return: transform
 424    """
 425
 426    if not vtreat.util.numeric_has_range(x):
 427        return None
 428    replacement = params["missingness_imputation"]
 429    try:
 430        replacement = imputation_map[incoming_column_name]
 431    except KeyError:
 432        pass
 433    if vtreat.util.can_convert_v_to_numeric(replacement):
 434        replacement_value = 0.0 + replacement
 435    elif callable(replacement):
 436        replacement_value = vtreat.util.summarize_column(x, fn=replacement)
 437    else:
 438        raise TypeError(
 439            "unexpected imputation type "
 440            + str(type(replacement))
 441            + " ("
 442            + incoming_column_name
 443            + ")"
 444        )
 445    if (
 446        pandas.isnull(replacement_value)
 447        or math.isnan(replacement_value)
 448        or math.isinf(replacement_value)
 449    ):
 450        raise ValueError(
 451            "replacement was bad "
 452            + incoming_column_name
 453            + ": "
 454            + str(replacement_value)
 455        )
 456    return CleanNumericTransform(
 457        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name, replacement_value=replacement_value
 458    )
 459

 461def fit_regression_impact_code(
 462    *,
 463    incoming_column_name: str,
 464    x,
 465    y,
 466    extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
 467    params: Dict[str, Any],
 468) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 469    """
 470    Fit regression impact code transform
 471
 472    :param incoming_column_name:
 473    :param x: training explanatory values
 474    :param y: training dependent values
 475    :param extra_args: optional extra arguments for fit_ methods
 476    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 477    :return:
 478    """
 479
 480    sf = vtreat.util.grouped_by_x_statistics(x, y)
 481    if sf.shape[0] <= 1:
 482        return None
 483    if params["use_hierarchical_estimate"]:
 484        sf["_impact_code"] = sf["_hest"] - sf["_gm"]
 485    else:
 486        sf["_impact_code"] = sf["_group_mean"] - sf["_gm"]
 487    sf = sf.loc[:, ["x", "_impact_code"]].copy()
 488    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_impact_code"
 489    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
 490    return YAwareMappedCodeTransform(
 491        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 492        derived_column_name=newcol,
 493        treatment="impact_code",
 494        code_book=sf,
 495        refitter=fit_regression_impact_code,
 496        extra_args=extra_args,
 497        params=params,
 498    )
 499
 500
 501def fit_regression_deviation_code(
 502    *,
 503    incoming_column_name: str,
 504    x,
 505    y,
 506    extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
 507    params: Dict[str, Any],
 508) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 509    """
 510    Fit regression deviation code transform
 511
 512    :param incoming_column_name:
 513    :param x: training explanatory values
 514    :param y: training dependent values
 515    :param extra_args: optional extra arguments for fit_ methods
 516    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 517    :return:
 518    """
 519
 520    sf = vtreat.util.grouped_by_x_statistics(x, y)
 521    if sf.shape[0] <= 1:
 522        return None
 523    sf["_deviation_code"] = numpy.sqrt(sf["_var"])
 524    sf = sf.loc[:, ["x", "_deviation_code"]].copy()
 525    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_deviation_code"
 526    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
 527    return YAwareMappedCodeTransform(
 528        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 529        derived_column_name=newcol,
 530        treatment="deviation_code",
 531        code_book=sf,
 532        refitter=fit_regression_deviation_code,
 533        extra_args=extra_args,
 534        params=params,
 535    )
 536

 538def fit_binomial_impact_code(
 539    *,
 540    incoming_column_name: str,
 541    x,
 542    y,
 543    extra_args: Dict[str, Any],
 544    params: Dict[str, Any],
 545) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 546    """
 547    Fit categorical impact code.
 548
 549    :param incoming_column_name:
 550    :param x: training explanatory values
 551    :param y: training dependent values
 552    :param extra_args: required extra arguments for fit_ methods
 553    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 554    :return:
 555    """
 556    outcome_target = (
 557        extra_args["outcome_target"],
 558    )  # TODO: document why this is a tuple
 559    var_suffix = extra_args["var_suffix"]
 560    y = numpy.asarray(numpy.asarray(y) == outcome_target, dtype=float)
 561    sf = vtreat.util.grouped_by_x_statistics(x, y)
 562    if sf.shape[0] <= 1:
 563        return None
 564    eps = 1.0e-3
 565    if params["use_hierarchical_estimate"]:
 566        sf["_logit_code"] = numpy.log((sf["_hest"] + eps) / (sf["_gm"] + eps))
 567    else:
 568        sf["_logit_code"] = numpy.log((sf["_group_mean"] + eps) / (sf["_gm"] + eps))
 569    sf = sf.loc[:, ["x", "_logit_code"]].copy()
 570    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_logit_code" + var_suffix
 571    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
 572    return YAwareMappedCodeTransform(
 573        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 574        derived_column_name=newcol,
 575        treatment="logit_code",
 576        code_book=sf,
 577        refitter=fit_binomial_impact_code,
 578        extra_args=extra_args,
 579        params=params,
 580    )

 583class IndicatorCodeTransform(VarTransform):
 584    """Class for indicator codes"""
 585
 586    def __init__(
 587        self,
 588        *,
 589        incoming_column_name: str,
 590        derived_column_names: List[str],
 591        levels: List,
 592        sparse_indicators: bool = False,
 593    ):
 594        """
 595
 596        :param incoming_column_name:
 597        :param derived_column_names:
 598        :param levels: leves we are encoding to indicators
 599        :param sparse_indicators: if True use sparse data structure
 600        """
 601        VarTransform.__init__(
 602            self,
 603            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 604            incoming_column_is_numeric=False,
 605            derived_column_names=derived_column_names,
 606            treatment="indicator_code",
 607        )
 608        self.levels_ = levels
 609        self.sparse_indicators_ = sparse_indicators
 610
 611    def transform(self, data_frame):
 612        """
 613        return a transformed data frame
 614
 615        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
 616        :param data_frame: incoming values
 617        :return: transformed values
 618        """
 619
 620        incoming_column_name = self.incoming_column_name_
 621        sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: data_frame[incoming_column_name]})
 622        bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
 623        sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
 624        col = sf[self.incoming_column_name_]
 625
 626        def f(i: int):
 627            """transform one column"""
 628            v = numpy.asarray(col == self.levels_[i]) + 0.0  # return numeric 0/1 coding
 629            if self.sparse_indicators_:
 630                v = pandas.arrays.SparseArray(v, fill_value=0.0)
 631            return v
 632
 633        res = None
 634        for ii in range(len(self.levels_)):
 635            if res is None:
 636                res = pandas.DataFrame({self.derived_column_names_[ii]: f(ii)})
 637            else:
 638                res[self.derived_column_names_[ii]] = f(ii)
 639        return res
 640
 641    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 642        """
 643        Return description of transform as a data frame.
 644
 645        :return: description of transform.
 646        """
 647
 648        description = pandas.DataFrame(
 649            {
 650                "treatment_class": "IndicatorCodeTransform",
 651                "treatment": self.treatment_,
 652                "orig_var": self.incoming_column_name_,
 653                "orig_was_numeric": self.incoming_column_is_numeric_,
 654                "variable": self.derived_column_names_.copy(),
 655                "value": replace_bad_with_sentinel(self.levels_),
 656                "replacement": 1.0,
 657            }
 658        )
 659        return description
 660
 661
 662def fit_indicator_code(
 663    *,
 664    incoming_column_name: str,
 665    x,
 666    min_fraction: float = 0.0,
 667    max_levels: Optional[int] = None,
 668    sparse_indicators: bool = False,
 669) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 670    """
 671    Fit indicator codes
 672
 673    :param incoming_column_name:
 674    :param x: training explanatory variables
 675    :param min_fraction:
 676    :param max_levels:
 677    :param sparse_indicators:
 678    :return:
 679    """
 680
 681    sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: x})
 682    bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
 683    sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
 684    counts = sf[incoming_column_name].value_counts()
 685    n = sf.shape[0]
 686    counts = counts[counts > 0]
 687    counts = counts[counts >= min_fraction * n]  # no more than 1/min_fraction symbols
 688    levels = [str(v) for v in counts.index]
 689    if (max_levels is not None) and (len(levels) > max_levels):
 690        level_frame = pandas.DataFrame({"levels": levels, "counts": counts})
 691        level_frame.sort_values(
 692            by=["counts", "levels"],
 693            ascending=[False, True],
 694            inplace=True,
 695            axis=0,
 696            ignore_index=True,
 697        )
 698        value_vec = level_frame["levels"].values
 699        levels = [value_vec[i] for i in range(max_levels)]
 700    if len(levels) < 1:
 701        return None
 702    return IndicatorCodeTransform(
 703        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 704        derived_column_names=vtreat.util.build_level_codes(incoming_column_name, levels),
 705        levels=levels,
 706        sparse_indicators=sparse_indicators,
 707    )
 708
 709
 710def fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name: str, x) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 711    """
 712    Fit a prevalence code
 713
 714    :param incoming_column_name:
 715    :param x: training explanatory values
 716    :return:
 717    """
 718
 719    sf = pandas.DataFrame({"x": x})
 720    bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf["x"])
 721    sf.loc[bad_posns, "x"] = bad_sentinel
 722    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
 723    n = sf.shape[0]
 724    sf["_ni"] = 1.0
 725    sf = pandas.DataFrame(sf.groupby("x")["_ni"].sum())
 726    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=False)
 727    sf["_hest"] = sf["_ni"] / n
 728    sf = sf.loc[:, ["x", "_hest"]].copy()
 729    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_prevalence_code"
 730    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
 731    sf[incoming_column_name] = sf[incoming_column_name].astype(str)
 732    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
 733    return MappedCodeTransform(
 734        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 735        derived_column_name=newcol,
 736        treatment="prevalence_code",
 737        code_book=sf
 738    )
 739
 740
 741# noinspection PyPep8Naming
 742def _prepare_variable_lists(
 743    *,
 744    X,
 745    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 746    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 747) -> Tuple[List[str], List[str], List[str], List[str], List[str]]:
 748    """
 749    Prepare lists of variables for variable treatment.
 750
 751    :param X: dependent variables
 752    :param cols_to_copy: columns to copy
 753    :param var_list: dependent variable names, if empty all non outcome and copy columns are used
 754    :return: cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list lists
 755    """
 756    if var_list is None:
 757        var_list = list(X.columns)
 758    else:
 759        var_list = list(var_list)
 760    if len(var_list) < 1:
 761        var_list = list(X.columns)
 762    assert len(var_list) > 0
 763    if cols_to_copy is None:
 764        cols_to_copy = []
 765    else:
 766        cols_to_copy = list(cols_to_copy)
 767    copy_set = set(cols_to_copy)
 768    var_list = [co for co in var_list if (not (co in copy_set))]
 769    v_counts = {v: vtreat.util.get_unique_value_count(X[v]) for v in var_list}
 770    var_list = {v for v in var_list if v_counts[v] > 1}
 771    if len(var_list) <= 0:
 772        raise ValueError("no variables")
 773    n = X.shape[0]
 774    all_bad: List[str] = []
 775    mis_list: List[str] = []
 776    for vi in var_list:
 777        n_bad = numpy.sum(vtreat.util.is_bad(X[vi]))
 778        if n_bad >= n:
 779            all_bad.append(vi)
 780        if (n_bad > 0) and (n_bad < n):
 781            mis_list.append(vi)
 782    var_list = [co for co in var_list if (not (co in set(all_bad)))]
 783    num_list = [co for co in var_list if vtreat.util.can_convert_v_to_numeric(X[co])]
 784    cat_list = [co for co in var_list if co not in set(num_list)]
 785    id_like = [co for co in cat_list if v_counts[co] >= n]
 786    if len(id_like) > 0:
 787        warnings.warn(
 788            "variable(s) "
 789            + ", ".join(id_like)
 790            + " have unique values per-row, dropping"
 791        )
 792        cat_list = [co for co in var_list if co not in set(id_like)]
 793    return cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list
 794
 795
 796# noinspection PyPep8Naming
 797def fit_numeric_outcome_treatment(
 798    *,
 799    X,
 800    y,
 801    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 802    outcome_name: str,
 803    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 804    params: Dict[str, Any],
 805    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
 806) -> TreatmentPlan:
 807    """
 808    Fit set of treatments in a regression situation.
 809
 810    :param X: training explanatory values
 811    :param y: training dependent values
 812    :param var_list: list of dependent variable names, if empty all non outcome and copy columns are used
 813    :param outcome_name: name for outcome column
 814    :param cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output
 815    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 816    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
 817    :return: transform plan
 818    """
 819    cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list = _prepare_variable_lists(
 820        X=X, cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy, var_list=var_list
 821    )
 822    xforms: List[Optional[VarTransform]] = []
 823    if "missing_indicator" in params["coders"]:
 824        num_set = set(num_list)
 825        for vi in mis_list:
 826            xforms.append(
 827                IndicateMissingTransform(
 828                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 829                    incoming_column_is_numeric=vi in num_set,
 830                    derived_column_name=vi + "_is_bad"
 831                )
 832            )
 833    if "clean_copy" in params["coders"]:
 834        for vi in num_list:
 835            xform = fit_clean_code(
 836                incoming_column_name=vi,
 837                x=X[vi],
 838                params=params,
 839                imputation_map=imputation_map,
 840            )
 841            if xform is not None:
 842                xforms.append(xform)
 843    for vi in cat_list:
 844        if "impact_code" in params["coders"]:
 845            xforms.append(
 846                fit_regression_impact_code(
 847                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 848                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
 849                    y=y,
 850                    extra_args=None,
 851                    params=params,
 852                )
 853            )
 854        if "deviation_code" in params["coders"]:
 855            xforms.append(
 856                fit_regression_deviation_code(
 857                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 858                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
 859                    y=y,
 860                    extra_args=None,
 861                    params=params,
 862                )
 863            )
 864        if "prevalence_code" in params["coders"]:
 865            xforms.append(
 866                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
 867            )
 868        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
 869            xforms.append(
 870                fit_indicator_code(
 871                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 872                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
 873                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
 874                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
 875                )
 876            )
 877    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
 878        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=y)
 879    return TreatmentPlan(
 880        outcome_name=outcome_name,
 881        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
 882        num_list=num_list,
 883        cat_list=cat_list,
 884        xforms=xforms,
 885    )
 886
 887
 888# noinspection PyPep8Naming
 889def fit_binomial_outcome_treatment(
 890    *,
 891    X,
 892    y,
 893    outcome_target,
 894    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 895    outcome_name: str,
 896    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 897    params: Dict[str, Any],
 898    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
 899) -> TreatmentPlan:
 900    """
 901
 902    :param X: training explanatory values
 903    :param y: training dependent values
 904    :param outcome_target: dependent value to consider positive or in class
 905    :param var_list: list of variables to process, if empty all non outcome and copy columns are used
 906    :param outcome_name: name for outcome column
 907    :param cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output
 908    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 909    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
 910    :return: transform plan
 911    """
 912    cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list = _prepare_variable_lists(
 913        X=X, cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy, var_list=var_list
 914    )
 915    xforms: List[Optional[VarTransform]] = []
 916    if "missing_indicator" in params["coders"]:
 917        num_set = set(num_list)
 918        for vi in mis_list:
 919            xforms.append(
 920                IndicateMissingTransform(
 921                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 922                    incoming_column_is_numeric=vi in num_set,
 923                    derived_column_name=vi + "_is_bad"
 924                )
 925            )
 926    if "clean_copy" in params["coders"]:
 927        for vi in num_list:
 928            xform = fit_clean_code(
 929                incoming_column_name=vi,
 930                x=X[vi],
 931                params=params,
 932                imputation_map=imputation_map,
 933            )
 934            if xform is not None:
 935                xforms.append(xform)
 936    extra_args = {"outcome_target": outcome_target, "var_suffix": ""}
 937    for vi in cat_list:
 938        if "logit_code" in params["coders"]:
 939            xforms.append(
 940                fit_binomial_impact_code(
 941                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 942                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
 943                    y=y,
 944                    extra_args=extra_args,
 945                    params=params,
 946                )
 947            )
 948        if "prevalence_code" in params["coders"]:
 949            xforms.append(
 950                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
 951            )
 952        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
 953            xforms.append(
 954                fit_indicator_code(
 955                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 956                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
 957                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
 958                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
 959                )
 960            )
 961    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
 962        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=y)
 963    return TreatmentPlan(
 964        outcome_name=outcome_name,
 965        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
 966        num_list=num_list,
 967        cat_list=cat_list,
 968        xforms=xforms,
 969    )
 970

 972# noinspection PyPep8Naming
 973def fit_multinomial_outcome_treatment(
 974    *,
 975    X,
 976    y,
 977    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 978    outcome_name: str,
 979    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 980    params: Dict[str, Any],
 981    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
 982) -> TreatmentPlan:
 983    """
 984    Fit a variable treatment for multinomial outcomes.
 985
 986    :param X: training explanatory values
 987    :param y: training dependent values
 988    :param var_list: list of variables to process, if empty all non outcome and copy columns are used
 989    :param outcome_name: name for outcome column
 990    :param cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output
 991    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 992    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
 993    :return:
 994    """
 995
 996    outcomes = [oi for oi in set(y)]
 997    assert len(outcomes) > 1
 998    cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list = _prepare_variable_lists(
 999        X=X, cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy, var_list=var_list
1000    )
1001    xforms: List[Optional[VarTransform]] = []
1002    if "missing_indicator" in params["coders"]:
1003        num_set = set(num_list)
1004        for vi in mis_list:
1005            xforms.append(
1006                IndicateMissingTransform(
1007                    incoming_column_name=vi,
1008                    incoming_column_is_numeric=vi in num_set,
1009                    derived_column_name=vi + "_is_bad"
1010                )
1011            )
1012    if "clean_copy" in params["coders"]:
1013        for vi in num_list:
1014            xform = fit_clean_code(
1015                incoming_column_name=vi,
1016                x=X[vi],
1017                params=params,
1018                imputation_map=imputation_map,
1019            )
1020            if xform is not None:
1021                xforms.append(xform)
1022    for vi in cat_list:
1023        for outcome in outcomes:
1024            if "impact_code" in params["coders"]:
1025                extra_args = {
1026                    "outcome_target": outcome,
1027                    "var_suffix": ("_" + str(outcome)),
1028                }
1029                xforms.append(
1030                    fit_binomial_impact_code(
1031                        incoming_column_name=vi,
1032                        x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
1033                        y=y,
1034                        extra_args=extra_args,
1035                        params=params,
1036                    )
1037                )
1038        if "prevalence_code" in params["coders"]:
1039            xforms.append(
1040                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
1041            )
1042        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
1043            xforms.append(
1044                fit_indicator_code(
1045                    incoming_column_name=vi,
1046                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
1047                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
1048                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
1049                )
1050            )
1051    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
1052        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=y)
1053    return TreatmentPlan(
1054        outcome_name=outcome_name,
1055        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
1056        num_list=num_list,
1057        cat_list=cat_list,
1058        xforms=xforms,
1059    )

1063def fit_unsupervised_treatment(
1064    *,
1065    X,
1066    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1067    outcome_name: str,
1068    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1069    params: Dict[str, Any],
1070    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
1071) -> TreatmentPlan:
1072    """
1073    Fit a data treatment in the unsupervised case.
1074
1075    :param X: training explanatory values
1076    :param var_list: list of variables to process, if empty all non copy columns are used
1077    :param outcome_name: name for outcome column
1078    :param cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output
1079    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1080    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
1081    :return:
1082    """
1083
1084    cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list = _prepare_variable_lists(
1085        X=X, cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy, var_list=var_list
1086    )
1087    xforms: List[Optional[VarTransform]] = []
1088    if "missing_indicator" in params["coders"]:
1089        num_set = set(num_list)
1090        for vi in mis_list:
1091            xforms.append(
1092                IndicateMissingTransform(
1093                    incoming_column_name=vi,
1094                    incoming_column_is_numeric=vi in num_set,
1095                    derived_column_name=vi + "_is_bad"
1096                )
1097            )
1098    if "clean_copy" in params["coders"]:
1099        for vi in num_list:
1100            xform = fit_clean_code(
1101                incoming_column_name=vi,
1102                x=X[vi],
1103                params=params,
1104                imputation_map=imputation_map,
1105            )
1106            if xform is not None:
1107                xforms.append(xform)
1108    for vi in cat_list:
1109        if "prevalence_code" in params["coders"]:
1110            xforms.append(
1111                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
1112            )
1113        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
1114            xforms.append(
1115                fit_indicator_code(
1116                    incoming_column_name=vi,
1117                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
1118                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
1119                    max_levels=params["indicator_max_levels"],
1120                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
1121                )
1122            )
1123    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
1124        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=None)
1125    return TreatmentPlan(
1126        outcome_name=outcome_name,
1127        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
1128        num_list=num_list,
1129        cat_list=cat_list,
1130        xforms=xforms,
1131    )

1133
1134def pre_prep_frame(
1135    x: pandas.DataFrame,
1136    *,
1137    col_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1138    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1139    cat_cols: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1140) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1141    """
1142    Create a copy of pandas.DataFrame x restricted to col_list union cols_to_copy with col_list - cols_to_copy
1143    converted to only string and numeric types.  New pandas.DataFrame has trivial indexing.  If col_list
1144    is empty it is interpreted as all columns.
1145
1146    :param x:
1147    :param col_list:
1148    :param cols_to_copy:
1149    :param cat_cols:
1150    :return:
1151    """
1152
1153    if cols_to_copy is None:
1154        cols_to_copy = []
1155    else:
1156        cols_to_copy = list(cols_to_copy)
1157    if col_list is None:
1158        col_list = []
1159    else:
1160        col_list = list(col_list)
1161    if len(col_list) <= 0:
1162        col_list = list(x.columns)
1163    x_set = set(x.columns)
1164    col_set = set(col_list)
1165    for ci in cols_to_copy:
1166        if (ci in x_set) and (ci not in col_set):
1167            col_list.append(ci)
1168    col_set = set(col_list)
1169    missing_cols = col_set - x_set
1170    if len(missing_cols) > 0:
1171        raise KeyError("referred to not-present columns " + str(missing_cols))
1172    cset = set(cols_to_copy)
1173    if len(col_list) <= 0:
1174        raise ValueError("no variables")
1175    x = x.loc[:, col_list]
1176    x = x.reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1177    cat_col_set = None
1178    if cat_cols is not None:
1179        cat_col_set = set(cat_cols)
1180    for c in x.columns:
1181        if c in cset:
1182            continue
1183        bad_ind = vtreat.util.is_bad(x[c])
1184        if cat_col_set is not None:
1185            numeric_col = c not in cat_col_set
1186        else:
1187            numeric_col = vtreat.util.can_convert_v_to_numeric(x[c])
1188        if numeric_col:
1189            x[c] = vtreat.util.safe_to_numeric_array(x[c])
1190        else:
1191            # https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22231592/pandas-change-data-type-of-series-to-string
1192            x[c] = x[c].astype(str)
1193        x.loc[bad_ind, c] = None
1194    return x
1195
1196
1197def _mean_of_single_column_pandas_list(val_list: Iterable[pandas.DataFrame]) -> float:
1198    """
1199    Compute the mean of non-nan positions of a bunch of single column data frames
1200
1201    :param val_list: a list of single column Pandas data frames
1202    :return: mean, or numpy.nan if there are no values
1203    """
1204
1205    if val_list is None:
1206        return numpy.nan
1207    val_list = [v for v in val_list]
1208    if len(val_list) <= 0:
1209        return numpy.nan
1210    if len(val_list) <= 1:
1211        d = val_list[0]
1212    else:
1213        d = pandas.concat(val_list, axis=0, sort=False)
1214    col = d.columns[0]
1215    d = d.loc[numpy.logical_not(vtreat.util.is_bad(d[col])), [col]]
1216    if d.shape[0] < 1:
1217        return numpy.nan
1218    res = numpy.mean(d[col].values)
1219    assert isinstance(res, float)  # type hint for PyCharm IDE
1220    return res
1221
1222
1223def cross_patch_refit_y_aware_cols(
1224    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.DataFrame, plan: TreatmentPlan, cross_plan
1225) -> None:
1226    """
1227    Re fit the y-aware columns according to cross plan.
1228    Clears out refitter_ values to None.
1229    Assumes each y-aware variable produces one derived column.
1230
1231    :param x: explanatory values
1232    :param y: dependent values
1233    :param res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
1234    :param plan: fitting plan
1235    :param cross_plan: cross validation plan
1236    :return: no return, res is altered in place
1237    """
1238
1239    if cross_plan is None or len(cross_plan) <= 1:
1240        for xf in plan.xforms:
1241            xf.refitter_ = None
1242        return
1243    incoming_colset = set(x.columns)
1244    derived_colset = set(res.columns)
1245    for xf in plan.xforms:
1246        if not xf.need_cross_treatment_:
1247            continue
1248        incoming_column_name = xf.incoming_column_name_
1249        derived_column_name = xf.derived_column_names_[0]
1250        if derived_column_name not in derived_colset:
1251            continue
1252        if incoming_column_name not in incoming_colset:
1253            raise KeyError("missing required column " + incoming_column_name)
1254        if xf.refitter_ is None:
1255            raise ValueError(
1256                "refitter is None: "
1257                + incoming_column_name
1258                + " -> "
1259                + derived_column_name
1260            )
1261
1262        # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1263        def maybe_transform(*, fit, X):
1264            """conditional patching"""
1265            if fit is None:
1266                return None
1267            return fit.transform(X)
1268
1269        patches = [
1270            maybe_transform(
1271                fit=xf.refitter_(
1272                    incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
1273                    x=x[incoming_column_name][cp["train"]],
1274                    y=y[cp["train"]],
1275                    extra_args=xf.extra_args_,
1276                    params=xf.params_,
1277                ),
1278                X=x.loc[cp["app"], [incoming_column_name]],
1279            )
1280            for cp in cross_plan
1281        ]
1282        # replace any missing sections with global average (slight data leak potential)
1283        avg = _mean_of_single_column_pandas_list(
1284            [pi for pi in patches if pi is not None]
1285        )
1286        if numpy.isnan(avg):
1287            avg = 0
1288        res[derived_column_name] = avg
1289        for i in range(len(cross_plan)):
1290            pi = patches[i]
1291            if pi is None:
1292                continue
1293            pi.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1294            cp = cross_plan[i]
1295            res.loc[cp["app"], derived_column_name] = numpy.asarray(
1296                pi[derived_column_name]
1297            ).reshape((len(pi),))
1298        res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[derived_column_name]), derived_column_name] = avg
1299    for xf in plan.xforms:
1300        xf.refitter_ = None
1301
1302
1303def cross_patch_user_y_aware_cols(
1304    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.DataFrame, params: Dict[str, Any], cross_plan
1305) -> None:
1306    """
1307    Re fit the user y-aware columns according to cross plan.
1308    Assumes each y-aware variable produces one derived column.
1309
1310    :param x: explanatory values
1311    :param y: dependent values
1312    :param res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
1313    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1314    :param cross_plan: cross validation plan
1315    :return: no return, res altered in place
1316    """
1317    if cross_plan is None or len(cross_plan) <= 1:
1318        return
1319    incoming_colset = set(x.columns)
1320    derived_colset = set(res.columns)
1321    if len(derived_colset) <= 0:
1322        return
1323    for ut in params["user_transforms"]:
1324        if not ut.y_aware_:
1325            continue
1326        instersect_in = incoming_colset.intersection(set(ut.incoming_vars_))
1327        instersect_out = derived_colset.intersection(set(ut.derived_vars_))
1328        if len(instersect_out) <= 0:
1329            continue
1330        if len(instersect_out) != len(ut.derived_vars_):
1331            raise ValueError("not all derived columns are in res frame")
1332        if len(instersect_in) != len(ut.incoming_vars_):
1333            raise KeyError("missing required columns")
1334        patches = [
1335            ut.fit(X=x.loc[cp["train"], ut.incoming_vars_], y=y[cp["train"]]).transform(
1336                X=x.loc[cp["app"], ut.incoming_vars_]
1337            )
1338            for cp in cross_plan
1339        ]
1340        for col in ut.derived_vars_:
1341            # replace any missing sections with global average (slight data leak potential)
1342            avg = _mean_of_single_column_pandas_list(
1343                [pi.loc[:, [col]] for pi in patches if pi is not None]
1344            )
1345            if numpy.isnan(avg):
1346                avg = 0
1347            res[col] = avg
1348            for i in range(len(cross_plan)):
1349                pi = patches[i]
1350                if pi is None:
1351                    continue
1352                pi.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1353                cp = cross_plan[i]
1354                res.loc[cp["app"], col] = numpy.asarray(pi[col]).reshape((len(pi),))
1355            res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[col]), col] = avg
1356
1357
1358def score_plan_variables(
1359    cross_frame: pandas.DataFrame,
1360    outcome,
1361    plan: TreatmentPlan,
1362    params: Dict[str, Any],
1363    *,
1364    is_classification: bool = False,
1365) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1366    """
1367    Quality score variables to build up score frame.
1368
1369    :param cross_frame: cross transformed explanatory variables
1370    :param outcome: dependent variable
1371    :param plan: treatment plan
1372    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1373    :param is_classification: logical, if True classification if False regression
1374    :return: score frame
1375    """
1376
1377    def describe_xf(xf):
1378        """describe variable transform"""
1379        description = pandas.DataFrame({"variable": xf.derived_column_names_})
1380        description["orig_variable"] = xf.incoming_column_name_
1381        description["treatment"] = xf.treatment_
1382        description["y_aware"] = xf.need_cross_treatment_
1383        return description
1384
1385    def describe_ut(ut):
1386        """describe user variable transform"""
1387        description = pandas.DataFrame(
1388            {"orig_variable": ut.incoming_vars_, "variable": ut.derived_vars_}
1389        )
1390        description["treatment"] = ut.treatment_
1391        description["y_aware"] = ut.y_aware_
1392        return description
1393
1394    var_table = pandas.concat(
1395        [describe_xf(xf) for xf in plan.xforms]
1396        + [
1397            describe_ut(ut)
1398            for ut in params["user_transforms"]
1399            if len(ut.incoming_vars_) > 0
1400        ],
1401        sort=False,
1402    )
1403    var_table.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1404    sf = vtreat.util.score_variables(
1405        cross_frame,
1406        variables=var_table["variable"],
1407        outcome=outcome,
1408        is_classification=is_classification,
1409    )
1410    score_frame = pandas.merge(var_table, sf, how="left", on=["variable"], sort=False)
1411    num_treatment_types = len(score_frame["treatment"].unique())
1412    score_frame["_one"] = 1.0
1413    score_frame["vcount"] = score_frame.groupby("treatment")["_one"].transform("sum")
1414    score_frame["default_threshold"] = 1.0 / (
1415        score_frame["vcount"] * num_treatment_types
1416    )
1417    score_frame.drop(["_one"], axis=1, inplace=True)
1418    score_frame["recommended"] = numpy.logical_and(
1419        score_frame["has_range"],
1420        numpy.logical_and(
1421            numpy.logical_not(
1422                numpy.logical_or(
1423                    numpy.isnan(score_frame["significance"]),
1424                    numpy.isnan(score_frame["PearsonR"]),
1425                )
1426            ),
1427            numpy.logical_and(
1428                score_frame["significance"] < score_frame["default_threshold"],
1429                numpy.logical_or(
1430                    score_frame["PearsonR"] > 0.0,
1431                    numpy.logical_not(score_frame["y_aware"]),
1432                ),
1433            ),
1434        ),
1435    )
1436    return score_frame
1437
1438
1439def pseudo_score_plan_variables(
1440    *, cross_frame, plan: TreatmentPlan, params: Dict[str, Any]
1441) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1442    """
1443    Build a score frame look-alike for unsupervised case.
1444
1445    :param cross_frame: cross transformed explanatory variables
1446    :param plan: treatment plan
1447    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1448    :return: score frame
1449    """
1450
1451    def describe_xf(xf):
1452        """describe variable transform"""
1453        description = pandas.DataFrame({"variable": xf.derived_column_names_})
1454        description["orig_variable"] = xf.incoming_column_name_
1455        description["treatment"] = xf.treatment_
1456        description["y_aware"] = xf.need_cross_treatment_
1457        return description
1458
1459    def describe_ut(ut):
1460        """describe user variable transform"""
1461        description = pandas.DataFrame(
1462            {"orig_variable": ut.incoming_vars_, "variable": ut.derived_vars_}
1463        )
1464        description["treatment"] = ut.treatment_
1465        description["y_aware"] = ut.y_aware_
1466        return description
1467
1468    score_frame = pandas.concat(
1469        [describe_xf(xf) for xf in plan.xforms]
1470        + [
1471            describe_ut(ut)
1472            for ut in params["user_transforms"]
1473            if len(ut.incoming_vars_) > 0
1474        ],
1475        sort=False,
1476    )
1477    score_frame.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1478
1479    score_frame["has_range"] = [
1480        vtreat.util.numeric_has_range(cross_frame[c]) for c in score_frame["variable"]
1481    ]
1482    score_frame["PearsonR"] = numpy.nan
1483    score_frame["significance"] = numpy.nan
1484    score_frame["recommended"] = score_frame["has_range"].copy()
1485    score_frame["_one"] = 1.0
1486    score_frame["vcount"] = score_frame.groupby("treatment")["_one"].transform("sum")
1487    score_frame.drop(["_one"], axis=1, inplace=True)
1488    return score_frame
1489
1490
1491class VariableTreatment(abc.ABC, sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.TransformerMixin):
1492    """
1493    Class for variable treatments, implements much of the sklearn pipeline/transformer
1494    API. https://sklearn-template.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_guide.html#transformer
1495    """
1496
1497    result_restriction: Optional[Set[str]]
1498    outcome_name_: Optional[str]
1499    outcome_target_: Optional[Any]
1500    var_list_: List[str]
1501    cols_to_copy_: List[str]
1502    params_: Dict[str, Any]
1503    plan_: Optional[TreatmentPlan]
1504    score_frame_: Optional[pandas.DataFrame]
1505    imputation_map_: Dict[str, Callable]
1506    last_fit_x_id_: Optional[str]
1507    cross_plan_: Optional[List[Dict[str, List[int]]]]
1508    cross_rows_: Optional[int]
1509    last_result_columns: Optional[List[str]]
1510
1511    def __init__(
1512        self,
1513        *,
1514        var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1515        outcome_name: Optional[str] = None,
1516        outcome_target: Optional[Any] = None,
1517        cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1518        params: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
1519        imputation_map: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
1520    ):
1521        """
1522
1523        :param var_list: variables we intend to encode, empty means all
1524        :param outcome_name: column name of outcome
1525        :param outcome_target: outcome column value we consider in class or True
1526        :param cols_to_copy: columns to not process, but copy over
1527        :param params: control and configuration parameters
1528        :param imputation_map: per column imputation strategies or values
1529        """
1530        if var_list is None:
1531            var_list = []
1532        else:
1533            var_list = vtreat.util.unique_items_in_order(var_list)
1534        if cols_to_copy is None:
1535            cols_to_copy = []
1536        else:
1537            cols_to_copy = vtreat.util.unique_items_in_order(cols_to_copy)
1538        if (outcome_name is not None) and (outcome_name not in set(cols_to_copy)):
1539            cols_to_copy.append(outcome_name)
1540        confused = set(cols_to_copy).intersection(set(var_list))
1541        if len(confused) > 0:
1542            raise ValueError(
1543                "variables in treatment plan and non-treatment: " + ", ".join(confused)
1544            )
1545        if imputation_map is None:
1546            imputation_map = dict()
1547        self.outcome_name_ = outcome_name
1548        self.outcome_target_ = outcome_target
1549        self.var_list_ = [vi for vi in var_list if vi not in set(cols_to_copy)]
1550        self.cols_to_copy_ = cols_to_copy
1551        if params is not None:
1552            self.params_ = params.copy()
1553        else:
1554            self.params_ = dict()
1555        self.imputation_map_ = imputation_map.copy()
1556        self.plan_ = None
1557        self.score_frame_ = None
1558        self.cross_rows_ = None
1559        self.cross_plan_ = None
1560        self.last_fit_x_id_ = None
1561        self.last_result_columns = None
1562        self.result_restriction = None
1563        self.clear()
1564
1565    def check_column_names(self, col_names: Iterable[str]) -> None:
1566        """
1567        Check that none of the column names we are working with are non-unique.
1568        Also check variable columns are all present (columns to copy and outcome allowed to be missing).
1569
1570        :param col_names:
1571        :return: None, raises exception if there is a problem
1572        """
1573
1574        col_names = [c for c in col_names]
1575        to_check = set(self.var_list_)
1576        if self.outcome_name_ is not None:
1577            to_check.add(self.outcome_name_)
1578        if self.cols_to_copy_ is not None:
1579            to_check.update(self.cols_to_copy_)
1580        seen = [c for c in col_names if c in to_check]
1581        if len(seen) != len(set(seen)):
1582            raise ValueError("duplicate column names in frame")
1583        missing = set(self.var_list_) - set(col_names)
1584        if len(missing) > 0:
1585            raise ValueError(f"missing required columns: {missing}")
1586
1587    def clear(self) -> None:
1588        """reset state"""
1589        self.plan_ = None
1590        self.score_frame_ = None
1591        self.cross_rows_ = None
1592        self.cross_plan_ = None
1593        self.last_fit_x_id_ = None
1594        self.last_result_columns = None
1595        self.result_restriction = None
1596
1597    def get_result_restriction(self):
1598        """accessor"""
1599        if self.result_restriction is None:
1600            return None
1601        return self.result_restriction.copy()
1602
1603    def set_result_restriction(self, new_vars) -> None:
1604        """setter"""
1605        self.result_restriction = None
1606        if (new_vars is not None) and (len(new_vars) > 0):
1607            self.result_restriction = set(new_vars)
1608
1609    @abc.abstractmethod
1610    def merge_params(self, p: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1611        """merge in use parameters"""
1612
1613    # sklearn pipeline step methods
1614
1615    # https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.base.TransformerMixin.html
1616
1617    # noinspection PyPep8Naming, PyUnusedLocal
1618    def fit(self, X, y=None, **fit_params):
1619        """
1620        sklearn fit.
1621
1622        :param X: explanatory variables
1623        :param y: (optional) dependent variable
1624        :param fit_params:
1625        :return: self (for method chaining)
1626        """
1627
1628        self.fit_transform(X=X, y=y)
1629        return self
1630
1631    # noinspection PyPep8Naming, PyUnusedLocal
1632    @abc.abstractmethod
1633    def fit_transform(self, X, y=None, **fit_params):
1634        """
1635        sklearn fit_transform, correct way to trigger cross methods.
1636
1637        :param X: explanatory variables
1638        :param y: (optional) dependent variable
1639        :param fit_params:
1640        :return: transformed data
1641        """
1642
1643    # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1644    @abc.abstractmethod
1645    def transform(self, X):
1646        """
1647        sklearn transform
1648
1649        :param X: explanatory variables
1650        :return: transformed data
1651        """
1652
1653    # https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.base.BaseEstimator.html
1654
1655    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal,PyMethodMayBeStatic
1656    def get_params(self, deep=True):
1657        """
1658        vtreat exposes a subset of controls as tunable parameters, users can choose this set
1659        by specifying the tunable_params list in object construction parameters
1660
1661        :param deep: ignored
1662        :return: dict of tunable parameters
1663        """
1664        return {ti: self.params_[ti] for ti in self.params_["tunable_params"]}
1665
1666    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal,PyMethodMayBeStatic
1667    def set_params(self, **params):
1668        """
1669        vtreat exposes a subset of controls as tunable parameters, users can choose this set
1670        by specifying the tunable_params list in object construction parameters
1671
1672        :param params:
1673        :return: self (for method chaining)
1674        """
1675
1676        for (k, v) in params.items():
1677            if k in self.params_["tunable_params"]:
1678                self.params_[k] = v
1679        return self
1680
1681    # extra methods to look more like sklearn objects
1682
1683    # https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline.html
1684
1685    # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1686    def fit_predict(self, X, y=None, **fit_params):
1687        """
1688        Alias for fit_transform()
1689
1690        :param X: explanatory variables
1691        :param y: (optional) dependent variable
1692        :param fit_params:
1693        :return: transformed data
1694        """
1695        return self.fit_transform(X=X, y=y, **fit_params)
1696
1697    # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1698    def predict(self, X):
1699        """
1700        Alias for transform.
1701
1702        :param X: explanatory variables
1703        :return: transformed data
1704        """
1705
1706        return self.transform(X)
1707
1708    # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1709    def predict_proba(self, X):
1710        """
1711        Alias for transform.
1712
1713        :param X: explanatory variables
1714        :return: transformed data
1715        """
1716
1717        return self.transform(X)
1718
1719    # https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/blob/master/sklearn/compose/_column_transformer.py
1720
1721    def get_feature_names(self, input_features=None):
1722        """
1723        Get list of produced feature names.
1724
1725        :param input_features: Optional, restrict to these features
1726        :return:
1727        """
1728        if self.score_frame_ is None:
1729            raise ValueError(
1730                "get_feature_names called on uninitialized vtreat transform"
1731            )
1732        if input_features is not None:
1733            input_features = [c for c in input_features]
1734        filter_to_recommended = False
1735        try:
1736            filter_to_recommended = self.params_["filter_to_recommended"]
1737        except KeyError:
1738            pass
1739        if filter_to_recommended:
1740            new_vars = [
1741                self.score_frame_["variable"][i]
1742                for i in range(self.score_frame_.shape[0])
1743                if self.score_frame_["has_range"][i]
1744                and self.score_frame_["recommended"][i]
1745                and (
1746                    input_features is None
1747                    or self.score_frame_["orig_variable"][i] in input_features
1748                )
1749            ]
1750        else:
1751            new_vars = [
1752                self.score_frame_["variable"][i]
1753                for i in range(self.score_frame_.shape[0])
1754                if self.score_frame_["has_range"][i]
1755                and (
1756                    input_features is None
1757                    or self.score_frame_["orig_variable"][i] in input_features
1758                )
1759            ]
1760        new_vars = new_vars + self.cols_to_copy_
1761        return new_vars
1762
1763    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1764        """
1765        Return description of transform as a data frame. Does not encode user steps. Not yet implemented for
1766        multinomial dependent variables.
1767
1768        :return: description of transform.
1769        """
1770
1771        assert self.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1772        assert self.score_frame_ is not None  # type hint
1773        xform_steps = [xfi for xfi in self.plan_.xforms]
1774        frames = [xfi.description_matrix() for xfi in xform_steps]
1775        res = pandas.concat(frames).reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1776        # restrict down to non-constant variables
1777        scored_vars = set(self.score_frame_["variable"][self.score_frame_["has_range"]])
1778        usable = [v in scored_vars for v in res["variable"]]
1779        res = res.loc[usable, :].reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1780        return res
1781
1782
1783def perform_transform(
1784    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, transform: VariableTreatment, params: Dict[str, Any]
1785) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1786    """
1787    Transform a data frame.
1788
1789    :param x: data to be transformed.
1790    :param transform: transform
1791    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1792    :return: new data frame
1793    """
1794    assert transform.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1795    xform_steps = [xfi for xfi in transform.plan_.xforms]
1796    user_steps = [stp for stp in params["user_transforms"]]
1797    # restrict down to to results we are going to use
1798    if (transform.result_restriction is not None) and (
1799        len(transform.result_restriction) > 0
1800    ):
1801        xform_steps = [
1802            xfi
1803            for xfi in xform_steps
1804            if len(
1805                set(xfi.derived_column_names_).intersection(
1806                    transform.result_restriction
1807                )
1808            )
1809            > 0
1810        ]
1811        user_steps = [
1812            stp
1813            for stp in user_steps
1814            if len(set(stp.derived_vars_).intersection(transform.result_restriction))
1815            > 0
1816        ]
1817    # check all required columns are present
1818    needs = set()
1819    for xfi in xform_steps:
1820        if xfi.incoming_column_name_ is not None:
1821            needs.add(xfi.incoming_column_name_)
1822    for stp in user_steps:
1823        if stp.incoming_vars_ is not None:
1824            needs.update(stp.incoming_vars_)
1825    missing = needs - set(x.columns)
1826    if len(missing) > 0:
1827        raise ValueError("missing required input columns " + str(missing))
1828    # do the work
1829    new_frames = [xfi.transform(x) for xfi in (xform_steps + user_steps)]
1830    new_frames = [frm for frm in new_frames if (frm is not None) and (frm.shape[1] > 0)]
1831    # see if we want to copy over any columns
1832    copy_set = set(transform.plan_.cols_to_copy)
1833    to_copy = [ci for ci in x.columns if ci in copy_set]
1834    if len(to_copy) > 0:
1835        cp = x.loc[:, to_copy].copy()
1836        new_frames = [cp] + new_frames
1837    if len(new_frames) <= 0:
1838        raise ValueError("no columns transformed")
1839    res = pandas.concat(new_frames, axis=1, sort=False)
1840    res.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1841    return res
1842
1843
1844def limit_to_appropriate_columns(
1845    *, res: pandas.DataFrame, transform: VariableTreatment
1846) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1847    """
1848    Limit down to appropriate columns.
1849
1850    :param res:
1851    :param transform:
1852    :return:
1853    """
1854    assert transform.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1855    assert transform.score_frame_ is not None  # type hint
1856    to_copy = set(transform.plan_.cols_to_copy)
1857    to_take = set(
1858        [
1859            ci
1860            for ci in transform.score_frame_["variable"][
1861                transform.score_frame_["has_range"]
1862            ]
1863        ]
1864    )
1865    if (transform.result_restriction is not None) and (
1866        len(transform.result_restriction) > 0
1867    ):
1868        to_take = to_take.intersection(transform.result_restriction)
1869    cols_to_keep = [ci for ci in res.columns if (ci in to_copy) or (ci in to_take)]
1870    if len(cols_to_keep) <= 0:
1871        raise ValueError("no columns retained")
1872    res = res[cols_to_keep].copy()
1873    res.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1874    return res

def ready_data_frame(d) -> Tuple[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, type]: 
37def ready_data_frame(d) -> Tuple[pandas.DataFrame, type]:
38    """
39    Convert an array-like object to a data frame for processing.
40
41    :param d: data frame like object to work with
42    :return: dataframe with string-named columns
43    """
44    orig_type = type(d)
45    if not isinstance(d, pandas.DataFrame):
46        d = pandas.DataFrame(d)
47    else:
48        d = d.copy()
49    d.columns = [str(c) for c in d.columns]  # convert column names to strings
50    return d, orig_type

Convert an array-like object to a data frame for processing.

Parameters
  • d: data frame like object to work with
Returns

dataframe with string-named columns

def back_to_orig_type_data_frame(d: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, orig_type: type) -> Tuple[Any, List[str]]: 
53def back_to_orig_type_data_frame(
54    d: pandas.DataFrame, orig_type: type
55) -> Tuple[Any, List[str]]:
56    """
57    Convert data frame back to ndarray if that was the original type.
58
59    :param d: data frame
60    :param orig_type: type of original object
61    :return: converted result
62    """
63    if not isinstance(d, pandas.DataFrame):
64        raise TypeError(
65            "Expected result to be a pandas.DataFrame, found: " + str(type(d))
66        )
67    columns = [c for c in d.columns]
68    if orig_type == numpy.ndarray:
69        d = numpy.asarray(d)
70    return d, columns

Convert data frame back to ndarray if that was the original type.

Parameters
  • d: data frame
  • orig_type: type of original object
Returns

converted result

class VarTransform(abc.ABC): 
 73class VarTransform(abc.ABC):
 74    """
 75    Base class for vtreat transforms
 76    """
 77
 78    incoming_column_name_: str
 79    incoming_column_is_numeric_: bool
 80    derived_column_names_: List[str]
 81    need_cross_treatment_: bool
 82    treatment_: str
 83    refitter_: Optional[Callable]
 84    extra_args_: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]
 85    params_: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]
 86
 87    def __init__(
 88        self,
 89        *,
 90        incoming_column_name: str,
 91        incoming_column_is_numeric: bool,
 92        derived_column_names: Iterable[str],
 93        treatment: str,
 94    ):
 95        """
 96
 97        :param incoming_column_name:
 98        :param incoming_column_is_numeric:
 99        :param derived_column_names:
100        :param treatment:
101        """
102
103        assert isinstance(incoming_column_name, str)
104        assert isinstance(incoming_column_is_numeric, bool)
105        assert not isinstance(derived_column_names, str)
106        derived_column_names = list(derived_column_names)
107        assert len(derived_column_names) > 0
108        assert numpy.all([isinstance(dni, str) for dni in derived_column_names])
109        assert isinstance(treatment, str)
110        self.incoming_column_name_ = incoming_column_name
111        self.incoming_column_is_numeric_ = incoming_column_is_numeric
112        self.derived_column_names_ = derived_column_names
113        self.treatment_ = treatment
114        self.need_cross_treatment_ = False
115        self.refitter_ = None
116        self.extra_args_ = None
117        self.params_ = None
118
119    @abc.abstractmethod
120    def transform(self, data_frame: pandas.DataFrame) -> pandas.DataFrame:
121        """
122        return a transformed data frame
123
124        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
125        :param data_frame: incoming values
126        :return: transformed values
127        """
128
129    @abc.abstractmethod
130    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
131        """
132        Return description of transform as a data frame.
133
134        :return: description of transform.
135        """

class TreatmentPlan: 
138class TreatmentPlan:
139    """
140    Class to carry treatment plans.
141    """
142
143    outcome_name: Optional[str]
144    cols_to_copy: Tuple[str, ...]
145    num_list: Tuple[str, ...]
146    cat_list: Tuple[str, ...]
147    xforms: Tuple[VarTransform, ...]
148
149    def __init__(
150            self,
151            *,
152            outcome_name: Optional[str] = None,
153            cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
154            num_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
155            cat_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
156            xforms: Iterable[Optional[VarTransform]]):
157        self.outcome_name = outcome_name
158        if cols_to_copy is None:
159            self.cols_to_copy = tuple()
160        else:
161            assert not isinstance(cols_to_copy, str)
162            self.cols_to_copy = tuple(cols_to_copy)
163        if num_list is None:
164            self.num_list = tuple()
165        else:
166            assert not isinstance(num_list, str)
167            self.num_list = tuple(num_list)
168        if cat_list is None:
169            self.cat_list = tuple()
170        else:
171            assert not isinstance(cat_list, str)
172            self.cat_list = tuple(cat_list)
173        non_empty_xforms: List[VarTransform] = [x for x in xforms if x is not None]
174        self.xforms = tuple(non_empty_xforms)
175        for c in self.cols_to_copy:
176            assert isinstance(c, str)
177        for c in self.num_list:
178            assert isinstance(c, str)
179        for c in self.cat_list:
180            assert isinstance(c, str)
181        if len(self.xforms) < 1:
182            raise ValueError("no treatments generated")
183        for x in self.xforms:
184            assert isinstance(x, VarTransform)

class MappedCodeTransform(VarTransform): 
187class MappedCodeTransform(VarTransform):
188    """Class for transforms that are a dictionary mapping of strings to numeric values"""
189
190    def __init__(
191        self,
192        *,
193        incoming_column_name: str,
194        derived_column_name: str,
195        treatment: str,
196        code_book: pandas.DataFrame,
197    ):
198        """
199
200        :param incoming_column_name:
201        :param derived_column_name:
202        :param treatment:
203        :param code_book: Pandas dataframe mapping values to impact codes
204        """
205
206        VarTransform.__init__(
207            self,
208            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
209            incoming_column_is_numeric=False,
210            derived_column_names=[derived_column_name],
211            treatment=treatment,
212        )
213        self.code_book_ = code_book
214
215    def transform(self, data_frame: pandas.DataFrame) -> pandas.DataFrame:
216        """
217        return a transformed data frame
218
219        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
220        :param data_frame: incoming values
221        :return: transformed values
222        """
223
224        incoming_column_name = self.incoming_column_name_
225        derived_column_name = self.derived_column_names_[0]
226        sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: data_frame[incoming_column_name]})
227        bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
228        sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
229        res = pandas.merge(
230            sf, self.code_book_, on=[self.incoming_column_name_], how="left", sort=False
231        )  # ordered by left table rows
232        # could also try pandas .map()
233        res = res[[derived_column_name]].copy()
234        res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[derived_column_name]), derived_column_name] = 0.0
235        return res
236
237    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
238        """
239        Return description of transform as a data frame.
240
241        :return: description of transform.
242        """
243
244        description = pandas.DataFrame(
245            {
246                "treatment_class": "MappedCodeTransform",
247                "treatment": self.treatment_,
248                "orig_var": self.incoming_column_name_,
249                "orig_was_numeric": self.incoming_column_is_numeric_,
250                "variable": self.derived_column_names_[0],
251                "value": replace_bad_with_sentinel(
252                    self.code_book_[self.incoming_column_name_]
253                ),
254                "replacement": self.code_book_[self.derived_column_names_[0]].copy(),
255            }
256        )
257        return description

300    def __init__(self,

387        res = pandas.DataFrame({self.derived_column_names_[0]: col + 0.0})
388        return res

def fit_clean_code( *, incoming_column_name: str, x, params: Dict[str, Any], imputation_map: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[vtreat.vtreat_impl.VarTransform]: 
410def fit_clean_code(
411    *,
412    incoming_column_name: str,
413    x,
414    params: Dict[str, Any],
415    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
416) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
417    """
418    Fit numeric clean column imputation transform
419
420    :param incoming_column_name: name of column
421    :param x: training values for column
422    :param params: control parameter dictionary
423    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
424    :return: transform
425    """
426
427    if not vtreat.util.numeric_has_range(x):
428        return None
429    replacement = params["missingness_imputation"]
430    try:
431        replacement = imputation_map[incoming_column_name]
432    except KeyError:
433        pass
434    if vtreat.util.can_convert_v_to_numeric(replacement):
435        replacement_value = 0.0 + replacement
436    elif callable(replacement):
437        replacement_value = vtreat.util.summarize_column(x, fn=replacement)
438    else:
439        raise TypeError(
440            "unexpected imputation type "
441            + str(type(replacement))
442            + " ("
443            + incoming_column_name
444            + ")"
445        )
446    if (
447        pandas.isnull(replacement_value)
448        or math.isnan(replacement_value)
449        or math.isinf(replacement_value)
450    ):
451        raise ValueError(
452            "replacement was bad "
453            + incoming_column_name
454            + ": "
455            + str(replacement_value)
456        )
457    return CleanNumericTransform(
458        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name, replacement_value=replacement_value
459    )
