  • params: control parameter dictionary
  • imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values

def fit_regression_impact_code( *, incoming_column_name: str, x, y, extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]], params: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[vtreat.vtreat_impl.VarTransform]: 
462def fit_regression_impact_code(
463    *,
464    incoming_column_name: str,
465    x,
466    y,
467    extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
468    params: Dict[str, Any],
469) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
470    """
471    Fit regression impact code transform
472
473    :param incoming_column_name:
474    :param x: training explanatory values
475    :param y: training dependent values
476    :param extra_args: optional extra arguments for fit_ methods
477    :param params: control parameter dictionary
478    :return:
479    """
480
481    sf = vtreat.util.grouped_by_x_statistics(x, y)
482    if sf.shape[0] <= 1:
483        return None
484    if params["use_hierarchical_estimate"]:
485        sf["_impact_code"] = sf["_hest"] - sf["_gm"]
486    else:
487        sf["_impact_code"] = sf["_group_mean"] - sf["_gm"]
488    sf = sf.loc[:, ["x", "_impact_code"]].copy()
489    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_impact_code"
490    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
491    return YAwareMappedCodeTransform(
492        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
493        derived_column_name=newcol,
494        treatment="impact_code",
495        code_book=sf,
496        refitter=fit_regression_impact_code,
497        extra_args=extra_args,
498        params=params,
499    )

def fit_regression_deviation_code( *, incoming_column_name: str, x, y, extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]], params: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[vtreat.vtreat_impl.VarTransform]: 
502def fit_regression_deviation_code(
503    *,
504    incoming_column_name: str,
505    x,
506    y,
507    extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
508    params: Dict[str, Any],
509) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
510    """
511    Fit regression deviation code transform
512
513    :param incoming_column_name:
514    :param x: training explanatory values
515    :param y: training dependent values
516    :param extra_args: optional extra arguments for fit_ methods
517    :param params: control parameter dictionary

519    """

521    sf = vtreat.util.grouped_by_x_statistics(x, y)

523        return None
524    sf["_deviation_code"] = numpy.sqrt(sf["_var"])

def fit_binomial_impact_code( *, incoming_column_name: str, x, y, extra_args: Dict[str, Any], params: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[vtreat.vtreat_impl.VarTransform]: 
539def fit_binomial_impact_code(
540    *,
541    incoming_column_name: str,
542    x,
543    y,
544    extra_args: Dict[str, Any],
545    params: Dict[str, Any],
546) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
547    """
548    Fit categorical impact code.
549
550    :param incoming_column_name:
551    :param x: training explanatory values
552    :param y: training dependent values
553    :param extra_args: required extra arguments for fit_ methods
554    :param params: control parameter dictionary
555    :return:
556    """
557    outcome_target = (
558        extra_args["outcome_target"],
559    )  # TODO: document why this is a tuple
560    var_suffix = extra_args["var_suffix"]
561    y = numpy.asarray(numpy.asarray(y) == outcome_target, dtype=float)
562    sf = vtreat.util.grouped_by_x_statistics(x, y)
563    if sf.shape[0] <= 1:
564        return None
565    eps = 1.0e-3
566    if params["use_hierarchical_estimate"]:
567        sf["_logit_code"] = numpy.log((sf["_hest"] + eps) / (sf["_gm"] + eps))
568    else:
569        sf["_logit_code"] = numpy.log((sf["_group_mean"] + eps) / (sf["_gm"] + eps))
570    sf = sf.loc[:, ["x", "_logit_code"]].copy()
571    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_logit_code" + var_suffix
572    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
573    return YAwareMappedCodeTransform(
574        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
575        derived_column_name=newcol,
576        treatment="logit_code",
577        code_book=sf,
578        refitter=fit_binomial_impact_code,
579        extra_args=extra_args,
580        params=params,
581    )

class IndicatorCodeTransform(VarTransform): 
584class IndicatorCodeTransform(VarTransform):
585    """Class for indicator codes"""
586
587    def __init__(
588        self,
589        *,
590        incoming_column_name: str,
591        derived_column_names: List[str],
592        levels: List,
593        sparse_indicators: bool = False,
594    ):
595        """
596
597        :param incoming_column_name:
598        :param derived_column_names:
599        :param levels: leves we are encoding to indicators
600        :param sparse_indicators: if True use sparse data structure
601        """
602        VarTransform.__init__(
603            self,
604            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
605            incoming_column_is_numeric=False,
606            derived_column_names=derived_column_names,
607            treatment="indicator_code",
608        )
609        self.levels_ = levels
610        self.sparse_indicators_ = sparse_indicators
611
612    def transform(self, data_frame):
613        """
614        return a transformed data frame
615
616        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
617        :param data_frame: incoming values
618        :return: transformed values
619        """
620
621        incoming_column_name = self.incoming_column_name_
622        sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: data_frame[incoming_column_name]})
623        bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
624        sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
625        col = sf[self.incoming_column_name_]
626
627        def f(i: int):
628            """transform one column"""
629            v = numpy.asarray(col == self.levels_[i]) + 0.0  # return numeric 0/1 coding
630            if self.sparse_indicators_:
631                v = pandas.arrays.SparseArray(v, fill_value=0.0)
632            return v
633
634        res = None
635        for ii in range(len(self.levels_)):
636            if res is None:
637                res = pandas.DataFrame({self.derived_column_names_[ii]: f(ii)})
638            else:
639                res[self.derived_column_names_[ii]] = f(ii)
640        return res
641
642    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
643        """
644        Return description of transform as a data frame.
645
646        :return: description of transform.
647        """
648
649        description = pandas.DataFrame(
650            {
651                "treatment_class": "IndicatorCodeTransform",
652                "treatment": self.treatment_,
653                "orig_var": self.incoming_column_name_,
654                "orig_was_numeric": self.incoming_column_is_numeric_,
655                "variable": self.derived_column_names_.copy(),
656                "value": replace_bad_with_sentinel(self.levels_),
657                "replacement": 1.0,
658            }
659        )
660        return description

def fit_indicator_code( *, incoming_column_name: str, x, min_fraction: float = 0.0, max_levels: Optional[int] = None, sparse_indicators: bool = False) -> Optional[vtreat.vtreat_impl.VarTransform]: 
663def fit_indicator_code(
664    *,
665    incoming_column_name: str,
666    x,
667    min_fraction: float = 0.0,
668    max_levels: Optional[int] = None,
669    sparse_indicators: bool = False,
670) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
671    """
672    Fit indicator codes
673
674    :param incoming_column_name:
675    :param x: training explanatory variables
676    :param min_fraction:
677    :param max_levels:
678    :param sparse_indicators:
679    :return:
680    """
681
682    sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: x})
683    bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
684    sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
685    counts = sf[incoming_column_name].value_counts()
686    n = sf.shape[0]
687    counts = counts[counts > 0]
688    counts = counts[counts >= min_fraction * n]  # no more than 1/min_fraction symbols
689    levels = [str(v) for v in counts.index]
690    if (max_levels is not None) and (len(levels) > max_levels):
691        level_frame = pandas.DataFrame({"levels": levels, "counts": counts})
692        level_frame.sort_values(
693            by=["counts", "levels"],
694            ascending=[False, True],
695            inplace=True,
696            axis=0,
697            ignore_index=True,
698        )
699        value_vec = level_frame["levels"].values
700        levels = [value_vec[i] for i in range(max_levels)]
701    if len(levels) < 1:
702        return None
703    return IndicatorCodeTransform(
704        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
705        derived_column_names=vtreat.util.build_level_codes(incoming_column_name, levels),
706        levels=levels,
707        sparse_indicators=sparse_indicators,
708    )

  • x: training explanatory variables
  • min_fraction:
  • max_levels:
  • sparse_indicators:

def fit_prevalence_code( incoming_column_name: str, x) -> Optional[vtreat.vtreat_impl.VarTransform]: 
711def fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name: str, x) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
712    """
713    Fit a prevalence code
714
715    :param incoming_column_name:
716    :param x: training explanatory values
717    :return:
718    """
719
720    sf = pandas.DataFrame({"x": x})
721    bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf["x"])
722    sf.loc[bad_posns, "x"] = bad_sentinel
723    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
724    n = sf.shape[0]
725    sf["_ni"] = 1.0
726    sf = pandas.DataFrame(sf.groupby("x")["_ni"].sum())
727    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=False)
728    sf["_hest"] = sf["_ni"] / n
729    sf = sf.loc[:, ["x", "_hest"]].copy()
730    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_prevalence_code"
731    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
732    sf[incoming_column_name] = sf[incoming_column_name].astype(str)
733    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
734    return MappedCodeTransform(
735        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
736        derived_column_name=newcol,
737        treatment="prevalence_code",
738        code_book=sf
739    )

  • x: training explanatory values

def fit_numeric_outcome_treatment( *, X, y, var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]], outcome_name: str, cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]], params: Dict[str, Any], imputation_map: Dict[str, Any]) -> vtreat.vtreat_impl.TreatmentPlan: 
798def fit_numeric_outcome_treatment(
799    *,
800    X,
801    y,
802    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
803    outcome_name: str,
804    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
805    params: Dict[str, Any],
806    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
807) -> TreatmentPlan:
808    """
809    Fit set of treatments in a regression situation.
810
811    :param X: training explanatory values
812    :param y: training dependent values
813    :param var_list: list of dependent variable names, if empty all non outcome and copy columns are used
814    :param outcome_name: name for outcome column
815    :param cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output
816    :param params: control parameter dictionary
817    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
818    :return: transform plan
819    """
820    cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list = _prepare_variable_lists(
821        X=X, cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy, var_list=var_list
822    )
823    xforms: List[Optional[VarTransform]] = []
824    if "missing_indicator" in params["coders"]:
825        num_set = set(num_list)
826        for vi in mis_list:
827            xforms.append(
828                IndicateMissingTransform(
829                    incoming_column_name=vi,
830                    incoming_column_is_numeric=vi in num_set,
831                    derived_column_name=vi + "_is_bad"
832                )
833            )
834    if "clean_copy" in params["coders"]:
835        for vi in num_list:
836            xform = fit_clean_code(
837                incoming_column_name=vi,
838                x=X[vi],
839                params=params,
840                imputation_map=imputation_map,
841            )
842            if xform is not None:
843                xforms.append(xform)
844    for vi in cat_list:
845        if "impact_code" in params["coders"]:
846            xforms.append(
847                fit_regression_impact_code(
848                    incoming_column_name=vi,
849                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
850                    y=y,
851                    extra_args=None,
852                    params=params,
853                )
854            )
855        if "deviation_code" in params["coders"]:
856            xforms.append(
857                fit_regression_deviation_code(
858                    incoming_column_name=vi,
859                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
860                    y=y,
861                    extra_args=None,
862                    params=params,
863                )
864            )
865        if "prevalence_code" in params["coders"]:
866            xforms.append(
867                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
868            )
869        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
870            xforms.append(
871                fit_indicator_code(
872                    incoming_column_name=vi,
873                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
874                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
875                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
876                )
877            )
878    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
879        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=y)
880    return TreatmentPlan(
881        outcome_name=outcome_name,
882        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
883        num_list=num_list,
884        cat_list=cat_list,
885        xforms=xforms,
886    )

  • outcome_name: name for outcome column
  • cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output

951                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
952            )
953        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
954            xforms.append(
955                fit_indicator_code(
956                    incoming_column_name=vi,
957                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
958                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
959                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
960                )
961            )
962    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
963        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=y)
964    return TreatmentPlan(
965        outcome_name=outcome_name,
966        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
967        num_list=num_list,
968        cat_list=cat_list,
969        xforms=xforms,
970    )

  • outcome_name: name for outcome column

def pre_prep_frame( x: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, *, col_list: Optional[Iterable[str]], cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]], cat_cols: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1135def pre_prep_frame(
1136    x: pandas.DataFrame,
1137    *,
1138    col_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1139    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1140    cat_cols: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1141) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1142    """
1143    Create a copy of pandas.DataFrame x restricted to col_list union cols_to_copy with col_list - cols_to_copy
1144    converted to only string and numeric types.  New pandas.DataFrame has trivial indexing.  If col_list
1145    is empty it is interpreted as all columns.
1146
1147    :param x:
1148    :param col_list:
1149    :param cols_to_copy:
1150    :param cat_cols:
1151    :return:
1152    """
1153
1154    if cols_to_copy is None:
1155        cols_to_copy = []
1156    else:
1157        cols_to_copy = list(cols_to_copy)
1158    if col_list is None:
1159        col_list = []
1160    else:
1161        col_list = list(col_list)
1162    if len(col_list) <= 0:
1163        col_list = list(x.columns)
1164    x_set = set(x.columns)
1165    col_set = set(col_list)
1166    for ci in cols_to_copy:
1167        if (ci in x_set) and (ci not in col_set):
1168            col_list.append(ci)
1169    col_set = set(col_list)
1170    missing_cols = col_set - x_set
1171    if len(missing_cols) > 0:
1172        raise KeyError("referred to not-present columns " + str(missing_cols))
1173    cset = set(cols_to_copy)
1174    if len(col_list) <= 0:
1175        raise ValueError("no variables")
1176    x = x.loc[:, col_list]
1177    x = x.reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1178    cat_col_set = None
1179    if cat_cols is not None:
1180        cat_col_set = set(cat_cols)
1181    for c in x.columns:
1182        if c in cset:
1183            continue
1184        bad_ind = vtreat.util.is_bad(x[c])
1185        if cat_col_set is not None:
1186            numeric_col = c not in cat_col_set
1187        else:
1188            numeric_col = vtreat.util.can_convert_v_to_numeric(x[c])
1189        if numeric_col:
1190            x[c] = vtreat.util.safe_to_numeric_array(x[c])
1191        else:
1192            # https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22231592/pandas-change-data-type-of-series-to-string
1193            x[c] = x[c].astype(str)
1194        x.loc[bad_ind, c] = None
1195    return x

Create a copy of pandas.DataFrame x restricted to col_list union cols_to_copy with col_list - cols_to_copy converted to only string and numeric types. New pandas.DataFrame has trivial indexing. If col_list is empty it is interpreted as all columns.

Parameters
  • x:
  • col_list:
  • cols_to_copy:
  • cat_cols:
Returns
def cross_patch_refit_y_aware_cols( *, x: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, plan: vtreat.vtreat_impl.TreatmentPlan, cross_plan) -> None: 
1224def cross_patch_refit_y_aware_cols(
1225    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.DataFrame, plan: TreatmentPlan, cross_plan
1226) -> None:
1227    """
1228    Re fit the y-aware columns according to cross plan.
1229    Clears out refitter_ values to None.
1230    Assumes each y-aware variable produces one derived column.
1231
1232    :param x: explanatory values
1233    :param y: dependent values
1234    :param res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
1235    :param plan: fitting plan
1236    :param cross_plan: cross validation plan
1237    :return: no return, res is altered in place
1238    """
1239
1240    if cross_plan is None or len(cross_plan) <= 1:
1241        for xf in plan.xforms:
1242            xf.refitter_ = None
1243        return
1244    incoming_colset = set(x.columns)
1245    derived_colset = set(res.columns)
1246    for xf in plan.xforms:
1247        if not xf.need_cross_treatment_:
1248            continue
1249        incoming_column_name = xf.incoming_column_name_
1250        derived_column_name = xf.derived_column_names_[0]
1251        if derived_column_name not in derived_colset:
1252            continue
1253        if incoming_column_name not in incoming_colset:
1254            raise KeyError("missing required column " + incoming_column_name)
1255        if xf.refitter_ is None:
1256            raise ValueError(
1257                "refitter is None: "
1258                + incoming_column_name
1259                + " -> "
1260                + derived_column_name
1261            )
1262
1263        # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1264        def maybe_transform(*, fit, X):
1265            """conditional patching"""
1266            if fit is None:
1267                return None
1268            return fit.transform(X)
1269
1270        patches = [
1271            maybe_transform(
1272                fit=xf.refitter_(
1273                    incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
1274                    x=x[incoming_column_name][cp["train"]],
1275                    y=y[cp["train"]],
1276                    extra_args=xf.extra_args_,
1277                    params=xf.params_,
1278                ),
1279                X=x.loc[cp["app"], [incoming_column_name]],
1280            )
1281            for cp in cross_plan
1282        ]
1283        # replace any missing sections with global average (slight data leak potential)
1284        avg = _mean_of_single_column_pandas_list(
1285            [pi for pi in patches if pi is not None]
1286        )
1287        if numpy.isnan(avg):
1288            avg = 0
1289        res[derived_column_name] = avg
1290        for i in range(len(cross_plan)):
1291            pi = patches[i]
1292            if pi is None:
1293                continue
1294            pi.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1295            cp = cross_plan[i]
1296            res.loc[cp["app"], derived_column_name] = numpy.asarray(
1297                pi[derived_column_name]
1298            ).reshape((len(pi),))
1299        res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[derived_column_name]), derived_column_name] = avg
1300    for xf in plan.xforms:
1301        xf.refitter_ = None

Re fit the y-aware columns according to cross plan. Clears out refitter_ values to None. Assumes each y-aware variable produces one derived column.

Parameters
  • x: explanatory values
  • y: dependent values
  • res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
  • plan: fitting plan
  • cross_plan: cross validation plan
Returns

no return, res is altered in place

def cross_patch_user_y_aware_cols( *, x: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, params: Dict[str, Any], cross_plan) -> None: 
1304def cross_patch_user_y_aware_cols(
1305    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.DataFrame, params: Dict[str, Any], cross_plan
1306) -> None:
1307    """
1308    Re fit the user y-aware columns according to cross plan.
1309    Assumes each y-aware variable produces one derived column.
1310
1311    :param x: explanatory values
1312    :param y: dependent values
1313    :param res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
1314    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1315    :param cross_plan: cross validation plan
1316    :return: no return, res altered in place
1317    """
1318    if cross_plan is None or len(cross_plan) <= 1:
1319        return
1320    incoming_colset = set(x.columns)
1321    derived_colset = set(res.columns)
1322    if len(derived_colset) <= 0:
1323        return
1324    for ut in params["user_transforms"]:
1325        if not ut.y_aware_:
1326            continue
1327        instersect_in = incoming_colset.intersection(set(ut.incoming_vars_))
1328        instersect_out = derived_colset.intersection(set(ut.derived_vars_))
1329        if len(instersect_out) <= 0:
1330            continue
1331        if len(instersect_out) != len(ut.derived_vars_):
1332            raise ValueError("not all derived columns are in res frame")
1333        if len(instersect_in) != len(ut.incoming_vars_):
1334            raise KeyError("missing required columns")
1335        patches = [
1336            ut.fit(X=x.loc[cp["train"], ut.incoming_vars_], y=y[cp["train"]]).transform(
1337                X=x.loc[cp["app"], ut.incoming_vars_]
1338            )
1339            for cp in cross_plan
1340        ]
1341        for col in ut.derived_vars_:
1342            # replace any missing sections with global average (slight data leak potential)
1343            avg = _mean_of_single_column_pandas_list(
1344                [pi.loc[:, [col]] for pi in patches if pi is not None]
1345            )
1346            if numpy.isnan(avg):
1347                avg = 0
1348            res[col] = avg
1349            for i in range(len(cross_plan)):
1350                pi = patches[i]
1351                if pi is None:
1352                    continue
1353                pi.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1354                cp = cross_plan[i]
1355                res.loc[cp["app"], col] = numpy.asarray(pi[col]).reshape((len(pi),))
1356            res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[col]), col] = avg

  • y: dependent values
  • res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
  • params: control parameter dictionary
  • cross_plan: cross validation plan
Returns

def score_plan_variables( cross_frame: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, outcome, plan: vtreat.vtreat_impl.TreatmentPlan, params: Dict[str, Any], *, is_classification: bool = False) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1359def score_plan_variables(
1360    cross_frame: pandas.DataFrame,
1361    outcome,
1362    plan: TreatmentPlan,
1363    params: Dict[str, Any],
1364    *,
1365    is_classification: bool = False,
1366) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1367    """
1368    Quality score variables to build up score frame.
1369
1370    :param cross_frame: cross transformed explanatory variables
1371    :param outcome: dependent variable
1372    :param plan: treatment plan
1373    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1374    :param is_classification: logical, if True classification if False regression
1375    :return: score frame
1376    """
1377
1378    def describe_xf(xf):
1379        """describe variable transform"""
1380        description = pandas.DataFrame({"variable": xf.derived_column_names_})
1381        description["orig_variable"] = xf.incoming_column_name_
1382        description["treatment"] = xf.treatment_
1383        description["y_aware"] = xf.need_cross_treatment_
1384        return description
1385
1386    def describe_ut(ut):
1387        """describe user variable transform"""
1388        description = pandas.DataFrame(
1389            {"orig_variable": ut.incoming_vars_, "variable": ut.derived_vars_}
1390        )
1391        description["treatment"] = ut.treatment_
1392        description["y_aware"] = ut.y_aware_
1393        return description
1394
1395    var_table = pandas.concat(
1396        [describe_xf(xf) for xf in plan.xforms]
1397        + [
1398            describe_ut(ut)
1399            for ut in params["user_transforms"]
1400            if len(ut.incoming_vars_) > 0
1401        ],
1402        sort=False,
1403    )
1404    var_table.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1405    sf = vtreat.util.score_variables(
1406        cross_frame,
1407        variables=var_table["variable"],
1408        outcome=outcome,
1409        is_classification=is_classification,
1410    )
1411    score_frame = pandas.merge(var_table, sf, how="left", on=["variable"], sort=False)
1412    num_treatment_types = len(score_frame["treatment"].unique())
1413    score_frame["_one"] = 1.0
1414    score_frame["vcount"] = score_frame.groupby("treatment")["_one"].transform("sum")
1415    score_frame["default_threshold"] = 1.0 / (
1416        score_frame["vcount"] * num_treatment_types
1417    )
1418    score_frame.drop(["_one"], axis=1, inplace=True)
1419    score_frame["recommended"] = numpy.logical_and(
1420        score_frame["has_range"],
1421        numpy.logical_and(
1422            numpy.logical_not(
1423                numpy.logical_or(
1424                    numpy.isnan(score_frame["significance"]),
1425                    numpy.isnan(score_frame["PearsonR"]),
1426                )
1427            ),
1428            numpy.logical_and(
1429                score_frame["significance"] < score_frame["default_threshold"],
1430                numpy.logical_or(
1431                    score_frame["PearsonR"] > 0.0,
1432                    numpy.logical_not(score_frame["y_aware"]),
1433                ),
1434            ),
1435        ),
1436    )
1437    return score_frame

Quality score variables to build up score frame.

Parameters
  • cross_frame: cross transformed explanatory variables
  • outcome: dependent variable
  • plan: treatment plan
  • params: control parameter dictionary
  • is_classification: logical, if True classification if False regression
Returns

score frame

def pseudo_score_plan_variables( *, cross_frame, plan: vtreat.vtreat_impl.TreatmentPlan, params: Dict[str, Any]) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1440def pseudo_score_plan_variables(
1441    *, cross_frame, plan: TreatmentPlan, params: Dict[str, Any]
1442) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1443    """
1444    Build a score frame look-alike for unsupervised case.
1445
1446    :param cross_frame: cross transformed explanatory variables
1447    :param plan: treatment plan
1448    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1449    :return: score frame
1450    """
1451
1452    def describe_xf(xf):
1453        """describe variable transform"""
1454        description = pandas.DataFrame({"variable": xf.derived_column_names_})
1455        description["orig_variable"] = xf.incoming_column_name_
1456        description["treatment"] = xf.treatment_
1457        description["y_aware"] = xf.need_cross_treatment_
1458        return description
1459
1460    def describe_ut(ut):
1461        """describe user variable transform"""
1462        description = pandas.DataFrame(
1463            {"orig_variable": ut.incoming_vars_, "variable": ut.derived_vars_}
1464        )
1465        description["treatment"] = ut.treatment_
1466        description["y_aware"] = ut.y_aware_
1467        return description
1468
1469    score_frame = pandas.concat(
1470        [describe_xf(xf) for xf in plan.xforms]
1471        + [
1472            describe_ut(ut)
1473            for ut in params["user_transforms"]
1474            if len(ut.incoming_vars_) > 0
1475        ],
1476        sort=False,
1477    )
1478    score_frame.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1479
1480    score_frame["has_range"] = [
1481        vtreat.util.numeric_has_range(cross_frame[c]) for c in score_frame["variable"]
1482    ]
1483    score_frame["PearsonR"] = numpy.nan
1484    score_frame["significance"] = numpy.nan
1485    score_frame["recommended"] = score_frame["has_range"].copy()
1486    score_frame["_one"] = 1.0
1487    score_frame["vcount"] = score_frame.groupby("treatment")["_one"].transform("sum")
1488    score_frame.drop(["_one"], axis=1, inplace=True)
1489    return score_frame

class VariableTreatment(abc.ABC, sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.TransformerMixin): 
1492class VariableTreatment(abc.ABC, sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.TransformerMixin):
1493    """
1494    Class for variable treatments, implements much of the sklearn pipeline/transformer
1495    API. https://sklearn-template.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_guide.html#transformer
1496    """
1497
1498    result_restriction: Optional[Set[str]]
1499    outcome_name_: Optional[str]
1500    outcome_target_: Optional[Any]
1501    var_list_: List[str]
1502    cols_to_copy_: List[str]
1503    params_: Dict[str, Any]
1504    plan_: Optional[TreatmentPlan]
1505    score_frame_: Optional[pandas.DataFrame]
1506    imputation_map_: Dict[str, Callable]
1507    last_fit_x_id_: Optional[str]
1508    cross_plan_: Optional[List[Dict[str, List[int]]]]
1509    cross_rows_: Optional[int]
1510    last_result_columns: Optional[List[str]]
1511
1512    def __init__(
1513        self,
1514        *,
1515        var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1516        outcome_name: Optional[str] = None,
1517        outcome_target: Optional[Any] = None,
1518        cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1519        params: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
1520        imputation_map: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
1521    ):
1522        """
1523
1524        :param var_list: variables we intend to encode, empty means all
1525        :param outcome_name: column name of outcome
1526        :param outcome_target: outcome column value we consider in class or True
1527        :param cols_to_copy: columns to not process, but copy over
1528        :param params: control and configuration parameters
1529        :param imputation_map: per column imputation strategies or values
1530        """
1531        if var_list is None:
1532            var_list = []
1533        else:
1534            var_list = vtreat.util.unique_items_in_order(var_list)
1535        if cols_to_copy is None:
1536            cols_to_copy = []
1537        else:
1538            cols_to_copy = vtreat.util.unique_items_in_order(cols_to_copy)
1539        if (outcome_name is not None) and (outcome_name not in set(cols_to_copy)):
1540            cols_to_copy.append(outcome_name)
1541        confused = set(cols_to_copy).intersection(set(var_list))
1542        if len(confused) > 0:
1543            raise ValueError(
1544                "variables in treatment plan and non-treatment: " + ", ".join(confused)
1545            )
1546        if imputation_map is None:
1547            imputation_map = dict()
1548        self.outcome_name_ = outcome_name
1549        self.outcome_target_ = outcome_target
1550        self.var_list_ = [vi for vi in var_list if vi not in set(cols_to_copy)]
1551        self.cols_to_copy_ = cols_to_copy
1552        if params is not None:
1553            self.params_ = params.copy()
1554        else:
1555            self.params_ = dict()
1556        self.imputation_map_ = imputation_map.copy()
1557        self.plan_ = None
1558        self.score_frame_ = None
1559        self.cross_rows_ = None
1560        self.cross_plan_ = None
1561        self.last_fit_x_id_ = None
1562        self.last_result_columns = None
1563        self.result_restriction = None
1564        self.clear()
1565
1566    def check_column_names(self, col_names: Iterable[str]) -> None:
1567        """
1568        Check that none of the column names we are working with are non-unique.
1569        Also check variable columns are all present (columns to copy and outcome allowed to be missing).
1570
1571        :param col_names:
1572        :return: None, raises exception if there is a problem
1573        """
1574
1575        col_names = [c for c in col_names]
1576        to_check = set(self.var_list_)
1577        if self.outcome_name_ is not None:
1578            to_check.add(self.outcome_name_)
1579        if self.cols_to_copy_ is not None:
1580            to_check.update(self.cols_to_copy_)
1581        seen = [c for c in col_names if c in to_check]
1582        if len(seen) != len(set(seen)):
1583            raise ValueError("duplicate column names in frame")
1584        missing = set(self.var_list_) - set(col_names)
1585        if len(missing) > 0:
1586            raise ValueError(f"missing required columns: {missing}")
1587
1588    def clear(self) -> None:
1589        """reset state"""
1590        self.plan_ = None
1591        self.score_frame_ = None
1592        self.cross_rows_ = None
1593        self.cross_plan_ = None
1594        self.last_fit_x_id_ = None
1595        self.last_result_columns = None
1596        self.result_restriction = None
1597
1598    def get_result_restriction(self):
1599        """accessor"""
1600        if self.result_restriction is None:
1601            return None
1602        return self.result_restriction.copy()
1603
1604    def set_result_restriction(self, new_vars) -> None:
1605        """setter"""
1606        self.result_restriction = None
1607        if (new_vars is not None) and (len(new_vars) > 0):
1608            self.result_restriction = set(new_vars)

1657    def get_params(self, deep=True):
1658        """

1665        return {ti: self.params_[ti] for ti in self.params_["tunable_params"]}

1667    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal,PyMethodMayBeStatic
1668    def set_params(self, **params):
1669        """
1670        vtreat exposes a subset of controls as tunable parameters, users can choose this set
1671        by specifying the tunable_params list in object construction parameters
1672
1673        :param params:
1674        :return: self (for method chaining)
1675        """
1676
1677        for (k, v) in params.items():
1678            if k in self.params_["tunable_params"]:
1679                self.params_[k] = v
1680        return self

1722    def get_feature_names(self, input_features=None):
1723        """
1724        Get list of produced feature names.
1725
1726        :param input_features: Optional, restrict to these features
1727        :return:
1728        """
1729        if self.score_frame_ is None:
1730            raise ValueError(
1731                "get_feature_names called on uninitialized vtreat transform"
1732            )
1733        if input_features is not None:
1734            input_features = [c for c in input_features]
1735        filter_to_recommended = False
1736        try:
1737            filter_to_recommended = self.params_["filter_to_recommended"]
1738        except KeyError:
1739            pass
1740        if filter_to_recommended:
1741            new_vars = [
1742                self.score_frame_["variable"][i]
1743                for i in range(self.score_frame_.shape[0])
1744                if self.score_frame_["has_range"][i]
1745                and self.score_frame_["recommended"][i]
1746                and (
1747                    input_features is None
1748                    or self.score_frame_["orig_variable"][i] in input_features
1749                )
1750            ]
1751        else:
1752            new_vars = [
1753                self.score_frame_["variable"][i]
1754                for i in range(self.score_frame_.shape[0])
1755                if self.score_frame_["has_range"][i]
1756                and (
1757                    input_features is None
1758                    or self.score_frame_["orig_variable"][i] in input_features
1759                )
1760            ]
1761        new_vars = new_vars + self.cols_to_copy_
1762        return new_vars
1763
1764    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1765        """
1766        Return description of transform as a data frame. Does not encode user steps. Not yet implemented for
1767        multinomial dependent variables.
1768
1769        :return: description of transform.
1770        """
1771
1772        assert self.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1773        assert self.score_frame_ is not None  # type hint
1774        xform_steps = [xfi for xfi in self.plan_.xforms]
1775        frames = [xfi.description_matrix() for xfi in xform_steps]
1776        res = pandas.concat(frames).reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1777        # restrict down to non-constant variables
1778        scored_vars = set(self.score_frame_["variable"][self.score_frame_["has_range"]])
1779        usable = [v in scored_vars for v in res["variable"]]
1780        res = res.loc[usable, :].reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1781        return res

def perform_transform( *, x: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, transform: vtreat.vtreat_impl.VariableTreatment, params: Dict[str, Any]) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1784def perform_transform(
1785    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, transform: VariableTreatment, params: Dict[str, Any]
1786) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1787    """
1788    Transform a data frame.
1789
1790    :param x: data to be transformed.
1791    :param transform: transform
1792    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1793    :return: new data frame
1794    """
1795    assert transform.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1796    xform_steps = [xfi for xfi in transform.plan_.xforms]
1797    user_steps = [stp for stp in params["user_transforms"]]
1798    # restrict down to to results we are going to use
1799    if (transform.result_restriction is not None) and (
1800        len(transform.result_restriction) > 0
1801    ):
1802        xform_steps = [
1803            xfi
1804            for xfi in xform_steps
1805            if len(
1806                set(xfi.derived_column_names_).intersection(
1807                    transform.result_restriction
1808                )
1809            )
1810            > 0
1811        ]
1812        user_steps = [
1813            stp
1814            for stp in user_steps
1815            if len(set(stp.derived_vars_).intersection(transform.result_restriction))
1816            > 0
1817        ]
1818    # check all required columns are present
1819    needs = set()
1820    for xfi in xform_steps:
1821        if xfi.incoming_column_name_ is not None:
1822            needs.add(xfi.incoming_column_name_)
1823    for stp in user_steps:
1824        if stp.incoming_vars_ is not None:
1825            needs.update(stp.incoming_vars_)
1826    missing = needs - set(x.columns)
1827    if len(missing) > 0:
1828        raise ValueError("missing required input columns " + str(missing))
1829    # do the work
1830    new_frames = [xfi.transform(x) for xfi in (xform_steps + user_steps)]
1831    new_frames = [frm for frm in new_frames if (frm is not None) and (frm.shape[1] > 0)]
1832    # see if we want to copy over any columns
1833    copy_set = set(transform.plan_.cols_to_copy)
1834    to_copy = [ci for ci in x.columns if ci in copy_set]
1835    if len(to_copy) > 0:
1836        cp = x.loc[:, to_copy].copy()
1837        new_frames = [cp] + new_frames
1838    if len(new_frames) <= 0:
1839        raise ValueError("no columns transformed")
1840    res = pandas.concat(new_frames, axis=1, sort=False)
1841    res.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1842    return res

Transform a data frame.

Parameters
  • x: data to be transformed.
  • transform: transform
  • params: control parameter dictionary
Returns

new data frame

def limit_to_appropriate_columns( *, res: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, transform: vtreat.vtreat_impl.VariableTreatment) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1845def limit_to_appropriate_columns(
1846    *, res: pandas.DataFrame, transform: VariableTreatment
1847) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1848    """
1849    Limit down to appropriate columns.
1850
1851    :param res:
1852    :param transform:
1853    :return:
1854    """
1855    assert transform.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1856    assert transform.score_frame_ is not None  # type hint
1857    to_copy = set(transform.plan_.cols_to_copy)
1858    to_take = set(
1859        [
1860            ci
1861            for ci in transform.score_frame_["variable"][
1862                transform.score_frame_["has_range"]
1863            ]
1864        ]
1865    )
1866    if (transform.result_restriction is not None) and (
1867        len(transform.result_restriction) > 0
1868    ):
1869        to_take = to_take.intersection(transform.result_restriction)
1870    cols_to_keep = [ci for ci in res.columns if (ci in to_copy) or (ci in to_take)]
1871    if len(cols_to_keep) <= 0:
1872        raise ValueError("no columns retained")
1873    res = res[cols_to_keep].copy()
1874    res.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1875    return res
